page.title: 03THE PARISH CHURCH
page.content: THORPE-LE-SOKEN'S PARISH CHURCH IS CALLED{ST. MICHAEL'S.}THE OLDEST PART IS THE NORMAN BASE OF THE FONT. THE 13TH CENTURY EFFIGY OF THE KNIGHT OF LANDERMERE LIES UNDER A DECORATED ARCH. THE TOWER WAS ADDED IN THE 16TH CENTURY AND CONTAINS 6 BELLS DATED FROM 1688 TO 1935. FROM THE TOP OF THE TOWER YOU CAN SEE FOR MILES. THE MEDIAEVAL SCREEN REMAINS, AND THE MUNIMENTS ROOM OVER THE PORCH, BUT THE GALLERIES HAVE BEEN REMOVED. BOX PEWS WERE CHANGED LAST CENTURY, AND TODAY THE CHURCH IS BEING MODERNISED. THE PLANS INCLUDE A TOILET, AND ENCLOSING AN AISLE WITH A GLASS SCREEN TO CREATE A SEPARATE ROOM. THE WEST WINDOW HAS BEEN REMOVED FOR REPAIR. THE PRESENT VICAR IS THE REVEREND BRIAN SHANNON WHO LIVES WITH HIS FAMILY IN THE NEW VICARAGE IN MILL LANE.
